required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improvement in Preschoolers' Participation as a Result of Occupational Therapy Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Cohort Study to Examine the Improvement in Preschoolers' Participation as a Result of Occupational Therapy Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the improvement of participation in everyday occupation among preschool children with mild developmental disabilities as a result of Occupational Therapy intervention.

detailed_description.textblock: Preschoolers suffering from mild developmental disabilities are being referred to Occupational Therapy (OT) clinics according to limitation in participating of daily occupations. As well these children often demonstrate behavior or emotional difficulties. The primary treatment goal is promoting participation yet many times the treatment focuses on child's performance skills and not on occupation based activities. Respectively its outcome measures are the child performance skills. This study will document the therapeutic intervention, and evaluate its impact on child participation as well on his performance skills and emotional aspects. Participants will be recruited from waiting list for Occupational Therapy at Clalit Health services, Child Development Institute, and will be evaluate four times. First time on referral to waiting list ( At the present time due to long waiting list, children are waiting about three to four months before starting OT intervention), second time before treatment, third time after three of treatments and last follow-up after three months.

primary_outcome.description: Improvement of Participation of daily occupation as measured with Child Participation Questionnaire (CPQ)

secondary_outcome.description: Pictorial scale of Perceived Competence and Social Acceptances for Young Children (PSPCSA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Child performance skills - Visual motor integration
Child performance skills - Draw a picture

clinical_study.condition: Limited Participation in Daily Life Activities

arm_group.description: group will be evaluated 4 times: on referral to waiting list for treatment, before and after 9-12 direct individual treatments of 45 minutes, and follow-up after 3 months.

intervention.description: Short term direct individual occupational therapy (9-12 weeks).Participants will receive occupational therapy intervention according to health law. The study will document the therapeutic intervention implemented in practice using the Documentation of Occupational Therapy Session during Intervention (DOTSI).

study_pop.textblock: Kindergarten's children referred to Occuptaion Therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- kindergarten students of regular education
- Hebrew speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Students of special education
- Attending physiotherapy or psychology treatments
- Autistic Spectrum Disorder
- Cerebral Palsy
- Spina Bifida
- Developmental Intellectual Disabilities
- Blindness
- Deafness
